instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: questionmark on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> please help
threads.message:
hi comunity.

I got a strange problem.

Got from customer an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with blinking question mark

I pulled out a working 256GB SDD from a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (2012) and insert that in the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Everything is booting and working ok.

Now I take the "bad" 128GB SSD from the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and insert it in the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and there it works fine without problems

put it back in the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> again only the question mark

So what is here the problem, need some help please. going crazy.

threads.title: questionmark on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> please help
threads.message:
What OSX has the "bad" SSD?
Could be an issue with APFS partition, if is not the original SSD from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, or board has been changed and BIOS doesn't support APFS yet.

threads.title: questionmark on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> please help
threads.message:
thanks. thats a posibility. on the "bad" SSD is installed Mojave

I cleaned the SSD and installed High Sierra, not working. Then i looked with the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> but the intallation process has format the SSd again with APFS before installing High Sierra

Ok, so I cleaned again and cloned my working Disk (High sierra without APFS) on the "bad" disk. Now that is working in the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>

So is there any posibility to change the BIOS for support APFS? I am now shure the client was trying to install or to update the system. In the beginning holding Alt while starting ("bad" SSD in <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>) there was a bootable disk named installer to see.

threads.title: questionmark on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> please help
threads.message:
Do fresh install of Mojave or High Sierra, in the board with problem.
BIOS will be automatically updated.

threads.title: questionmark on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> please help
threads.message:
yes, that worked, thanks a lot

[SOLVED]
